alert.note: Alert for Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 20 at 10:58AM MST until November 21 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes portions of I-25 near Raton Pass. Strong winds could cause areas of blowing snow and reduced visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The majority of the accumulating snowfall will occur this evening and overnight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
